confession.devil_appearance: grand homme habillé de blanc, with shining face
confession.seduction_context: Initially claimed it was her 'bon ange' (good angel) appearing to her on multiple occasions - first at croix de perigoutte on a Friday, then near church of St. Mihiel in Ban d'Etival when her husband was sick, and behind cross of Parichamps when praying for sick animals. Under torture admitted these were meetings with Mre Persin and that she renounced God
powder_types: powder for malefices (thrown away according to initial confession, but later admitted using it)
herbs to cure animals (given by master)
sabbat_locations: cross of Perrichamps (described as meeting place, not sabbat)

witnesses.name: Jehennon femme à Jean Jeandel de La Bolle

testimony.quarrel_subject: Called Jehenne's son 'fils de genoxe' several times

witnesses.name: Marguitte femme Jean Anthoine de Haillieulle

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: on day of marriage or day after

Marguitte veuve de Jean Gamel de Haillieulle
Dieudonnée, veuve de Jean George Noel de Haillieulle
Mathiatte, femme à Colas Demenge Willaume de Heillieulle

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: sudden death at last St. Urbain

witnesses.name: Colas Demenge le Roy, de Haillieulle

testimony.quarrel_subject: Refused to collect a load of wood for Jehenne

witnesses.name: Jacot Hocley de La Moictresse des Etiges
Holbin le Jallay des Trois Maisons faulbourg de Saint Dié

testimony.quarrel_subject: Jehenne's son (forester in bois de la Magdelaine) wrongly caused him to be fined; delayed paying the franc to the forester
testimony.threat_quote: it would be 'un cher franc pour luy'

timeline.subject: Jehenne Stablo
timeline.details: Informations preparatoires contre Jehenne Stablo de Haillieulle, accused by Laurence femme à George Tolbay of Saint Margarée

timeline.subject: Jehenne Stablo
timeline.details: First interrogation; gave biographical information and denied accusations

timeline.subject: Jehenne Stablo
timeline.details: Confronted with Laurence, wife of George Tolbay, who claimed to have seen her at sabbat

timeline.subject: Jehenne Stablo
timeline.details: Voluntary confession after being sent back to prison - admitted seduction by Mre Parsin 18 years before, attending sabbat at Ramberg twice, but claimed she threw away powder and did no malefices

timeline.subject: Jehenne Stablo
timeline.details: Retraction of confession - totally denied first confession, said it was made against promise of release

timeline.subject: Jehenne Stablo
timeline.details: Continued to deny confession; confronted with witnesses with no event of consequence

timeline.subject: Jehenne Stablo
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves question extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Jehenne Stablo
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture (racking) - withstood first session, confessed during second session

timeline.subject: Jehenne Stablo
timeline.details: Death sentence from Change de Nancy

timeline.subject: Jehenne Stablo
timeline.details: She discharges all those she had accused of being at sabbat, except Laurence wife of George Tolbay

accomplices_named.name: Laurence femme à George Tolbay
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat as cook; already convicted before same court at Saint-Dié; only accomplice Jehenne did not discharge before execution

accomplices_named.name: man from St. Margarée or Ramomeix
le Gros Mathieu
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat - described as 'ja viel et ancien' (already old and ancient) - later discharged

prior_accusations.context: Accused Jehenne before the informations preparatoires began; claimed to have seen her at sabbat

notable_quotes.speaker: first wife of Jean Jeandel
notable_quotes.french: que par elle, elle s'en alloit mourir
notable_quotes.english: that because of her, she was going to die
notable_quotes.context: Dying woman pushed Jehenne away when she came to visit, died an hour later

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne Stablo
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle ne scavoit d'ou diable elle venoit
notable_quotes.english: that she didn't know where the devil she came from
notable_quotes.context: When asked by men after hailstorm what she was doing and where she came from, coming from direction of la goutte xailce

notable_quotes.speaker: Boys guarding animals
notable_quotes.french: que chose seure elle venoit du sabbat
notable_quotes.english: that certainly she came from the sabbat
notable_quotes.context: Boys seeing Jehenne after hailstorm, well-dressed and wet

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne Stablo
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle s'en allant une fois à la croix de perigoutte rencontra ung grand homme habillé de blanc, c'estoit ung jour de vendredy, et luy demanda ou elle alloit et la reconforta, luy estoit d'advis que c'estoit Dieu et luy dit qu'elle face bien à poinct
notable_quotes.english: that going once to the cross of perigoutte she met a great man dressed in white, it was a Friday, and he asked her where she was going and comforted her, she was of the opinion it was God and he told her to do well
notable_quotes.context: Initial interrogation describing apparition she later admitted was the devil

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne Stablo
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle est aussi innocente comme la vierge Marie
notable_quotes.english: that she is as innocent as the Virgin Mary
notable_quotes.context: Response to Colas Demenge Willaume when discussing fears of arrest

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne Stablo
notable_quotes.french: pourquoy il ne la fit prendre donc, qu'elle ne le luy a poinct fait perdre
notable_quotes.english: why didn't he have her arrested then, she didn't make him lose it
notable_quotes.context: Response when asked about Colas Collatte wanting to accuse her

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne Stablo
notable_quotes.french: sy qu'il est reduict quasy en pauvreté
notable_quotes.english: so that he is reduced almost to poverty
notable_quotes.context: Describing Jean Jeandel's losses of animals

relationships.evidence_text: Jean Jeandel and his wife Jehennon both testified
married one Stablo, who had now been dead for about 13 years
married Colas le Bueffre, widowed after three years

his father-in-law had blamed her for various losses
Multiple witnesses refer to Jehenne's son who was a forester in bois de la Magdelaine
had her daughter with her when seen after hailstorm

economic_context.details: Jean Jeandel reduced 'quasy en pauvreté' (almost to poverty) due to animal losses. Multiple witnesses mentioned economic losses from animal deaths. Jehenne killed Jeanne la Chaisne because 'she didn't pay her enough for some spinning' (under torture confession). Animals straying into Jehenne's meadow mentioned. Jehenne's son was forester who fined Holbin le Jallay, leading to dispute over payment of franc. Economic hardship evident in community's fear of prosecuting her due to cost.

harms_catalog.harm_description: dying woman pushed Jehenne away saying she was causing her death, died an hour later
16 'rouges bestes' died in one 6-month period
ox became sick, partially recovered with magical cure, sold for 9 ecus instead of worth of 30

harms_catalog.harm_description: became very ill, lost use of legs, still felt effects sometimes

weather_events: heavy hailstorm about 20 years before that devastated half the village finage and scattered animals
economic_hardship_indicators: Jean Jeandel 'reduict quasy en pauvreté' (reduced almost to poverty) due to animal losses
Multiple witnesses feared prosecuting Jehenne because they would 'consume their little wealth' without conviction
Jehenne killed woman over underpayment for spinning work
Community reliance on animal labor and agriculture - multiple ox/cattle deaths caused severe hardship

Friday (day when Jehenne met apparition at cross)
Sunday clothes (mentioned as what Jehenne wore after hailstorm)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Anthoine Jean Jacquemin called her 'sorciere et genoxe' several times publicly, but Jehenne said she couldn't take action because he was alone (no witnesses) and she lacked means
Dieudonnée widow of Jean George Noel called her 'meschante femme et ribaulde'
Jehenne's son (forester) wrongly caused Holbin le Jallay to be fined
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Holbin paid fine to seigneur but delayed payment to forester

legal_context.redress_outcome: Jehenne said she lacked the means to take Anthoine Jacquemin to court for calling her witch

hearsay_chains.content: Anthoine Jean Jacquemin called her 'sorciere et genoxe' several times
Colas Collatte wanted to have Jehenne arrested for ox death but neighbors dissuaded him
Account of hailstorm incident 20 years before
Father-in-law blamed Jehenne for various animal losses
Jehenne confided fears of arrest 8 years before

emotional_state_notes: vigorous denials when confronted with Laurence
declared voluntary confession after being sent back to prison (possibly coerced with false promise)
totally retracted confession claiming it was made against promise of release
gave very inconsistent accounts during preliminary torture questioning
confessed during second session of racking
suddenly said 'she was damning herself and they were making her confess things that were false' during torture
reaffirmed confessions an hour after torture
discharged all sabbat accomplices except Laurence before execution

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said the woman who was pushed away was Margo Sebille of Sainte Margarée, not herself

When asked about Colas Collatte wanting to accuse her, said 'pourquoy il ne la fit prendre donc, qu'elle ne le luy a poinct fait perdre' (why didn't he have her arrested then, she didn't make him lose it)

third_parties.name: Margo Sebille
third_parties.context: Jehenne claimed Margo Sebille of Sainte Margarée was the one who pushed away dying wife of Jean Jeandel, not herself; Margo had died 4 years before trial

third_parties.name: Anthoine Jean Jacquemin
third_parties.context: Publicly called Jehenne 'sorciere et genoxe' multiple times 8 years before; threatened to prosecute her; now deceased ('late Anthoine Jean Jacquemin')

third_parties.name: Colas Collatte
third_parties.context: Lost an ox and blamed Jehenne so strongly was almost on point of having her arrested, but neighbors dissuaded him saying he would waste his wealth and she might not be convicted

third_parties.name: Jehenne's son (forester)
third_parties.context: Forester in bois de la Magdelaine; called 'fils de genoxe' by Jehennon; had quarrel with Jacot Hocley; wrongly fined Holbin le Jallay and threatened him

third_parties.name: Jehenne's daughter
third_parties.context: Was with Jehenne when seen coming from mountains after hailstorm

third_parties.name: Jeanne la Chaisne, wife of viel prevost

third_parties.context: Jehenne confessed under torture to giving her powder

third_parties.name: Stablo

extraction_metadata.notes: Comprehensive extraction from English translation of trial record. Trial shows classic pattern: long-standing reputation (30+ years), economic disputes over animal losses, public accusations 8 years prior, initial denial, voluntary confession (possibly coerced with false promise of release), retraction, torture approval, confession under torture, retraction of most accomplice accusations before execution. Notable features include the 'counter-magic' healing rituals using materials from accused's property, the hailstorm incident with sabbat suspicions, and Jehenne's creative defense claiming divine apparitions. Economic hardship theme throughout - community feared prosecuting her due to cost and uncertain outcome. Confession under torture appears forced and inconsistent.
